author: holgerd77
content:
We have Osaka/Fusaka ready EthereumJS releases out:
https://x.com/EFJavaScript/status/1986494890293784951

author: ralexstokes
content: yeah, i'd say the source of truth would be something like https://github.com/eth-clients/mainnet/blob/main/metadata/genesis.json#L30 like pari posted

author: ralexstokes
content: and also copied to the relevant specs etc

author: ralexstokes
content: if we wanted to handle "inter-fork" updates on metaEIPs, we could just update the most recent live metaEIP

author: holgerd77
content:
Hmm, not so much of a fan to have consensus relevant chain parameter changes implicitly defined in some genesis configuration. 

And in Fusaka Meta-EIP this brings the Meta-EIP into some not so lucky hybrid state - still potentially moving while formally been moved to "Final". ðŸ¤”

What about a dedicated Meta-EIP for "Fusaka -> Glamsterdam BPOs" - which we keep in the "Living" state (just discovered in EIP-1 https://eips.ethereum.org/) and then move to "Final" once the latter fork has been reached? And this Meta-EIP is then linked to from the Fusaka Meta-EIP, and we already move BPO1 and BPO2 over there?

author: ralexstokes
content: yeah, an interfork metaeip seems reasonable

author: ralexstokes
content: it would also help with comms/signaling as any interfork BPO adjustments we make will basically incur all of the coordination cost of a named fork
